description.value:
The US Public Health Profiles Library is a collection of reusable architecture and content profiles representing common public health concepts and patterns. It is intended as a complement to US Core that is used to ease implementation burden of healthcare organizations, electronic health record companies, public health agencies, and others involved in the US public health endeavor.
The US Public Health Profiles Library will be instituted in close conjunction with US Core and have an analogous process for implementation, moderation, review, and approval. The intent is to re-use US Core profiles wherever possible and only add profiles that are needed for common public health needs. The library will evolve over time and may be supported by an adjunct profiles registry that includes developing and informational profiles for public health use.
After evaluation and harmonization analysis of two large multi-condition and multi-use case public health projects â€“ eCR and MedMorph, it was determined that there are many common elements between the two IGs. The short-term scope of this library includes elements common to the above-mentioned FHIR IGs and will define a US Realm specific framework that defines common elements for the implementation guides. The longer-term scope of this will include analysis and inclusion of data elements from Vital Records Death Reporting, Vital Records Birth and Fetal Death Reporting, and other Public Health use cases.
To avoid defining the same profiles multiple times, we have created a US Public Health Profiles Library for use by Public Health and other FHIR standards development efforts to define appropriate FHIR profiles, value sets, etc., once and allow them to be referenced by each of the specific implementation guides. This USPHPL will provide a starting point and framework for inclusion in multiple use case specific implementation guides focused on the exchange of Public Health information to support interoperability among public health systems and reduce provider and implementer burden.

display.value: US Public Health Emergency Outbreak Information

name.value: US Public Health Emergency Outbreak Information

description.value: This profile represents information that is required during a public health emergency/outbreak. This information can be highly variable, so a generic structure has been chosen to represent it.
This Patient profile represents a US Public Health Patient.
Bundle Resource profile for exchanging public health messages, knowledge artifacts or content.
Bundle Resource profile for exchanging one of public health messages, knowledge artifacts or content.
This Composition profile represents a public health composition.
This Condition profile represents the signs, symptoms, and diagnoses related to an public health event.
This Encounter profile represents the encounter related to the event.

display.value: US Public Health Survey Practitioner Group

name.value: US Public Health Survey Practitioner Group

description.value: Group Resource profile for specifying survey participant groups, research groups.

display.value: US Public Health Characteristics of Home Environment

name.value: US Public Health Characteristics of Home Environment

description.value: This Observation profile represents characteristics of the patient's home environment.

This profile represents the Disability Element defined here: https://aspe.hhs.gov/basic-report/hhs-implementation-guidance-data-collection-standards-race-ethnicity-sex-primary-language-and-disability-status
This profile represents the postpartum status of a patient.

display.value: US Public Health Pregnancy Outcome Observation

name.value: US Public Health Pregnancy Outcome Observation

description.value: This profile represents a result of the pregnancy such as live birth, still birth, miscarriage, etc.

display.value: US Public Health Pregnancy Status Observation

name.value: US Public Health Pregnancy Status Observation

description.value: This profile represents current and/or prior pregnancy statuses and their date ranges, enabling investigators to determine if a patient was pregnant, possibly pregnant, not pregnant or whether the pregnancy status was unknown during a particular date range.

display.value: US Public Health Exposure Contact Information

name.value: US Public Health Exposure Contact Information

description.value: This Observation profile represents potential patient exposure and contact information.

This Observation profile represents transportation details such as the type of transport (plane, train, ship, etc.) along with any associated information (e.g. name of cruise ship, flight number, airport, seat number, cabin number, etc.).
This Organization profile represents an organization involved in public health.

display.value: US Public Health Tribal Affiliation Extension

name.value: US Public Health Tribal Affiliation Extension

description.value: This Extension profile represents an affiliated tribe name and whether or not the patient is an enrolled member
This is the Endpoint Resource profile for the IG used to specify receivers addresses
This Location profile represents the location/facility in which care was provided.

display.value: US Public Health Date Determined Extension

name.value: US Public Health Date Determined Extension

description.value: The date a status or observation was determined (date of determination).

display.value: US Public Health Date Recorded Extension

name.value: US Public Health Date Recorded Extension

description.value: The date a status or observation was recorded (recorded date).
This profile describes the US Public Health PlanDefinition.
This PractitionerRole profile represents the roles and organizations a practitioner involved in public health is associated with.

display.value: US Public Health Determination of Reportability Rule Extension

name.value: US Public Health Determination of Reportability Rule Extension

description.value: This Extension profile represents a rule that led to the determination of reportability.

display.value: US Public Health Determination of Reportability Extension

name.value: US Public Health Determination of Reportability Extension

description.value: This Extension profile represents the determination of reportability.

display.value: US Public Health Determination of Reportability Reason Extension

name.value: US Public Health Determination of Reportability Reason Extension

description.value: This Extension profile represents the reason for the determination of reportability.
This Observation profile represents a patient's travel history.
This Extension profile represents where the patient traveled to or visited as an address e.g.: country, state, city, street address (if applicable).

display.value: US Public Health Alternative Expression Extension

name.value: US Public Health Alternative Expression Extension

description.value: This extension represents an US Public Health Alternative Expression
The US Public Health TriggerDefinition NamedEvent Value Set is a 'starter set' of codes for identifying named events uniquely in TriggerDefinition instances contained within a PlanDefinition.
The computable library profile sets the minimum expectations for a computable CQL library.

This profile sets the minimum expectations for an executable CQL library. Specifically, the profile requires that the library contain one of ELM XML or JSON content, the compiled representation of the CQL logic.

display.value: US Public Health Supplemental Valueset Library

name.value: US Public Health Supplemental Valueset Library

description.value: Defines the library containing the US Public Health supplemental value sets.

display.value: US Public Health Triggering ValueSet Library

name.value: US Public Health Triggering ValueSet Library

description.value: Defines the library containing the US Public Health triggering value sets.
